arm_group.description: Patients with a pre-emptive kidney transplantation from deceased donors
Patients who have experienced a short pre-transplant dialysis period of less than 12 months

brief_summary.textblock:
The main objective is to assess the psychological impact of pre-emptive kidney
      transplantation on patients' quality of life taking into account psychological adjustment
      (response shift), compared to patients who have experienced a short pre-transplant dialysis
      period of less than 12 months.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pre-emptive Kidney Transplantation Quality of Life

detailed_description.textblock:
The following outcomes will also be compared between Patients with Pre-emptive
      Transplantation and Patients with Dialysis before Transplantation : a) changes in quality of
      life, subjective well-being, perceived anxiety and depressive disorders as well as perceived
      stress during follow-up taking into account psychological adjustment (response shift) ; b)
      The coping strategies (process of managing stressful circumstances) and post-traumatic
      growth (positive psychological change experienced as a result of the struggle with highly
      challenging life circumstances) ; c) The 2-year post transplantation graft survival and
      patient outcomes: evolution of the Graft Filtration Rate, the proteinuria level ; d) The
      Kidney Transplant Failure Score (KTFS, patent N°0959043) at one year post transplantation ;
      e) The post-transplantation time to return to work and patients compliance to treatment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Adult patients with a pre-emptive transplantation from deceased donor and patients
             who have experienced a short pre-transplant dialysis period of less than 12 months
             (matched inclusion on recipient gender and center).

          -  Only first and single kidney transplantation will be considered.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Re-transplantation or simultaneous transplantation (kidney-pancreas for instance)

          -  Patients under guardianship.

intervention.description: Patient-Reported Outcomes completion every six months prior to surgery, at hospital discharge, and at 3,6,12, and 24 months

facility.name: CHU LYON - Hôpitla E. Herriot - Médecine de transplantation et immunoclinique
CHU MARSEILLE - Hôpital de la Conception - Santé Publique
CHU MONTPELLIER - Hôpital Lapeyronie - Service de Néphrologie
CHU NANTES - Hôtel Dieu-Jean Monnet - ITUN
AP-HP - Hôpital St Louis - Service de Néphrologie et Transplantation Rénale
CHU TOULOUSE - Hôpitalt Rangueil - Service de Néphrologie

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Benefits Associated With Pre-emptive Kidney Transplantation. Prospective, Multicenter and Controlled Study of Quality of Life, Psychological Adjustment Processes and Medical Outcomes of Patients Receiving a Pre-emptive Kidney Transplant Compared to a Similar Population of Recipients After a Dialysis Period of Less Than One Year

authority: France: Comité consultatif sur le traitement de l'information en matière de recherche dans le domaine de la santé
France: The Commission nationale de l’informatique et des libertés

primary_outcome.description:
The change in quality of life, taking into account psychological adjustment of the patient (response shift).
This criterion will be measured by a specifically developed questionnaire : ReTransQol
primary_outcome.time_frame: every six months prior to surgery, hospital discharge, and 3, 6, 12, and 24 months

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Generic QoL will be assessed with the SF36 every 6 months prior to surgery, at hospital discharge and at three, six, 12, and 24 months, and compared between PPT versus PDT.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every six months prior to surgery, hospital discharge, and 3, 6, 12, and 24 months

secondary_outcome.description: Anxiety and depressive disorders will be assessed every six months prior to surgery, at hospital discharge, and at three, six, 12, and 24 months, and compared between PPT versus PDT using the questionnaire HAD (Hospital Anxiety and Depression scale)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every six months prior to surgery, hospital discharge, and 3, 6, 12, and 24 months

secondary_outcome.description: Subjective well-being will be assessed every six months prior to surgery, at hospital discharge and at three, six, 12, and 24 months, and compared between PPT versus PDT using the satisfaction with life scale (SWLS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every six months prior to surgery, hospital discharge, and 3, 6, 12, and 24 months

secondary_outcome.description: The perceived stress will be assessed every six months prior to surgery, at hospital discharge, and at three, six, 12, and 24 months, and compared between PPT versus PDT with the Perceived Stress Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every six months prior to surgery, hospital discharge, and 3, 6, 12, and 24 months

secondary_outcome.description: The coping strategies will be assessed at six and 24 months post transplantation and compared between PPT versus PDT with the Brief Cope
secondary_outcome.time_frame: six months prior to surgery, hospital discharge, and 3, 6, 12, and 24 months

secondary_outcome.description: The posttraumatic growth will be assessed at six and 24 months post transplantation and compared between PPT versus PDT with the Posttraumatic Growth Inventory (PTGI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: six months prior to surgery, hospital discharge, and 3, 6, 12, and 24 months

secondary_outcome.description: The evolution of the Graft Filtration Rate (GFR) will be compared between PPT versus PDT. This clinical parameter will be collected at hospital discharge, and three, six, 12 and 24-months post-transplantation. Renal function will be estimated using the 4-variables MDRD formula
secondary_outcome.measure: Evolution of the Graft Filtration Rate

secondary_outcome.description: The evolution of the daily proteinuria level will be compared between PPT versus PDT. This clinical parameter will be collected at hospital discharge, and three, six, 12 and 24-months post-transplantation. Conventionally, proteinuria is diagnosed by a simple dipstick test
The Kidney Transplant Failure Score (KTFS) at one year post transplantation will be compared between PPT versus PDT.

secondary_outcome.measure: Post-transplantation time to return to work

secondary_outcome.description: Compliance of patients will be assessed every six months prior to surgery, at hospital discharge, and at three, six, 12, and 24 months, and compared between PPT versus PDT with the Girerd questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: six months prior to surgery, hospital discharge, and 3, 6, 12, and 24 months

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Supportive Care
